fulltext:
Curriculum Vitae 
Name 
Hung T, Ta (Born 17.11.1981) 
Email address 
tathehung@yahoo.com 
Home address 
Apartment 606, 17T2 Building, Hapulico Complex, 1 Nguyen 
Huy Tuong Street, Thanh Xuan, Hanoi, Vietnam 
Academic qualifications 
2018         Ph.D Crop physiology (Lincoln University, New Zealand) 
2011         M Hort. Sci. (Seoul National University, South Korea) 
2004         B Agr. Sci.     (Thai Nguyen University, Vietnam) 
Qualification summary 
Over ten years of R&D research experience in field and greenhouse crop experimentations. Knowledge of 
crop physiology and crop production modelling.  Skill in statistical analysis and background in irrigation of 
horticultural crops. Publication and presentation of various articles and reports at international journals 
and conferences. 
Work experiences 
Institute of Regional Research and Development, MOST, Vietnam     (March 2018- present) 
Manager of R&D Department 
- Fundraising and coordinating R&D projects on agriculture and rural development.  
- Identifying and assessing new methods/models of agriculture production to transfer into practice.  
Lincoln University, Canterbury, New Zealand                                         (February 2014- March 2018) 
Ph.D. study 
- Understanding of crop growth and development of lucerne with different fall dormancy ratings. 
Institute of Regional Research and Development, MOST, Vietnam    (March 2012- December 2013) 
Researcher 
- Identified new grasses and crop varieties for their suitable application on these areas of mixed crop-
animal production.   
Seoul National University, South Korea                                         (March 2009-January 2012) 
Master study 
- Investigated paprika transpiration model for its application in greenhouse soilless irrigation.  
- Participated in research on paprika/lettuce growth responses by using LED’s, CO2 supplementation. 
Institute of Regional Research and Development, MOST, Vietnam         (April 2007-January 2009) 
Research Assistance 
- Designed and undertaken field trials to test crop varieties suitable for these mountainous areas.  
1 | Page of 3 
Technology Services for Vegetable, Fruit and Flower                                    (May 2005-April 2007) 
In Vinh Phuc Province, Vietnam 
Technician 
- Designed, implemented and tested new vegetable, and flower varieties. 
Publications (selected) 
Ta, T.H., Teixeira, I.E., Brown, E.H and Moot, J.D. (2019) Yield and quality changes in lucerne of different fall 
dormancy ratings under three defoliation regimes (resubmitted based on reviewer’s comments to 
European Journal of Agronomy). 
Ta, T.H., Moot, J.D., Teixeira, I.E. 2016. Impact of autumn (fall) dormancy rating on growth and development 
of seedling lucerne. Journal of New Zealand Grasslands. 78:169-176. 
Ta, H. T., Teixeira, I.E. and Moot, J.D. In Press. Impact of fall dormancy rating on phenological development 
of regrowth lucerne. Proceedings of the Australian Agronomy Conference. 
Ta, T.H., Shin, J.H., Noh, E.H, and Son, J.E. 2012. Transpiration, growth, and water use efficiency of paprika 
plants (Capsicum annuum L.) as affected by irrigation frequency. Hort. Environ. Biotechnol. 53:129-134. 
Ta, T.H., Shin, J.H., Ahn, T.I, and Son, J.E. 2011. Modelling of transpiration of paprika (Capsicum annuum L.) 
plants based on radiation and leaf area index in soilless culture. Hort. Environ. Biotechnol. 52:265-269. 
Oral presentations 
- Presented at the 18th Australian Society of Agronomy Conference, Ballarat, Australia, 24-28 September 
2017. 
- Presented at the Perennial Pasture Systems, Ararat, Australia, 29 September 2017. 
- Presented at New Zealand Grassland Association Conference – Timaru, New Zealand, 2016. 
References 
Name:                     Derrick Moot, Professor of plant science. Lincoln University, New Zealand 
                                Tel: +64 3 423 0705, E-mail: derrick.moot@lincoln.ac.nz                 
Name:                        Hamish Brown, Scientist. The New Zealand Institute for Plant & Food Research Limited 
                                 Tel: +64 3 325 9394, E-mail: hamish.brown@plantandfood.co.nz 
Name:                        Minh Nguyen, Director. Institute of Regional Research and Development, Vietnam 
                                 Tel: +84 243 2151247, E-mail: nguyendacbinhminh@gmail.com 
2 | Page of 3
